title: The Circularity Ladder: Where Does Your Organization Stand?
content:
🪜 Where does your organization stand on the circularity ladder?

At Nordic Circular Summit 2025, Dan Mikkin from HI Advisory introduced a powerful self-assessment framework:

**The Five Levels:**

1️⃣ **CONVENTIONAL**
Play by the book. No initiative to become more circular.

2️⃣ **GREEN**
Good mindset, but circularity narrowed down to waste management.

3️⃣ **SUSTAINABLE**
Circularity as a goal, movement toward it, but not yet part of core business model. Still a sidetrack.

4️⃣ **RESTORATIVE**
Circularity and sustainability as core parts of business model.

5️⃣ **REGENERATIVE**
Rare pioneering companies that restore the environment — giving back more than they take from nature and society.

**The Honest Assessment:**

"Try to be objective. Don't imagine where you are or make yourselves any nicer than reality is."

Most organizations overestimate their position. The value comes from honesty.

**The 5-Year Question:**

Where are you today? Where do you want to be in 5 years?

Be realistic. What can you actually achieve?

**The Framework:**

This is from the Circular Design Toolbox — a 15-tool, open-source system developed by HI Advisory and Enterprise Estonia.

Put this ladder on your wall. Everything you work on should target moving up.

What level is your organization at today?

title: If It Doesn't Add Up, It's Charity
content:
💰 "If it adds up, it all makes sense. If it doesn't, then it's a charity project."

— Dan Mikkin, HI Advisory

At #NordicCircularSummit, the Circular Design Toolbox team delivered a crucial reminder:

**We're talking about actual working business models.**

The Circular Business Model Canvas forces you to answer:

🔹 **Value**: What's your new circular value proposition? (One sentence)
🔹 **Users**: Who are your critical users and how will you communicate with them?
🔹 **Partners**: Who helps you achieve the circular model?
🔹 **Resources**: What new sourcing streams do you need?
🔹 **Costs**: How much to transition?
🔹 **Revenue**: What's the possible income?
🔹 **Profit Timeline**: When do you break even?
🔹 **Impact**: Environmental and social benefits?

**The Test:**

If the financials don't work, the model won't survive. Circular economy isn't about sacrifice — it's about building businesses that create value while regenerating.

The Circular Design Toolbox is free and open-source. 15 tools covering understand, define, ideate, and develop phases.

A good transition process uses 5-7 tools over several months.

Get circular — but make sure it adds up.

title: The Linear Economy Is Winning (And Getting Worse)
content:
📉 The linear economy isn't just dominating — it's growing faster.

At Nordic Circular Summit 2025, Dan Mikkin from HI Advisory shared an uncomfortable truth:

"The linear economy is heavily dominating the world. And it's not moving in the right direction. We have just the recent data coming in and it's getting worse. Not that we are having less circular solutions, but the linear economy is growing even faster."

**The Context:**

🔴 Planetary boundaries increasingly crossed
🔴 2025: Ocean acidification now exceeds repair capacity
🔴 Circular solutions exist but can't keep pace with linear growth

**The Framework:**

HI Advisory uses the Donut Economics model — planetary boundaries + social foundations. The goal: good lives for all within Earth's limits.

**The Response:**

They created the Circular Design Toolbox — 15 open-source tools to help companies transition.

Based on the R Strategies framework:

→ **REFUSE**: Eliminate harmful materials or activities
→ **REDUCE**: If you can't refuse, minimize
→ **REPLACE**: Substitute with better alternatives
→ **EXTEND LIFECYCLE**: Repair, remanufacture, new services
→ **REGENERATE**: Give back more than you take

**The Hierarchy:**

Regenerative business models sit at the top — "rare pioneering companies which actually restore the environment around them."

But first, you have to know where you actually stand.

Self-assessment. Value chain mapping. Stakeholder research. Ideation. Business model validation.

5-7 tools. Several months. Real transformation.

The toolbox is free. The question is: will you use it before the linear economy grows faster?

5-7 tools over several months for good transition. Self-assessment first — be honest, not aspirational.

title: Day 2: The Circular Design Toolbox
content:
🧰 Day 2 Session Highlights from Nordic Circular Summit 2025!

"The Circular Design Toolbox" — a practical, free, open-source framework for companies transitioning to circular business models.

Presented by Dan Mikkin and Maarja Karlson from HI Advisory (Estonia).

TOP MOMENTS:

📉 THE UNCOMFORTABLE CONTEXT
"The linear economy is heavily dominating the world. And it's getting worse. Not that we have less circular solutions — but the linear economy is growing even faster."

Planetary boundaries are increasingly crossed. 2025 data shows ocean acidification now exceeds the ocean's capacity to repair itself.

🍩 THE DONUT ECONOMICS APPROACH
The toolbox is based on enabling good lives for all within planetary boundaries — not just environmental, but social foundations too.

🪜 THE CIRCULARITY LADDER
Five levels to assess where your organization really stands:

1️⃣ Conventional — No circular initiative
2️⃣ Green — Good mindset, but circularity = waste management
3️⃣ Sustainable — Circularity as goal, but still a sidetrack
4️⃣ Restorative — Circularity as core business model
5️⃣ Regenerative — Give back more than you take

"Try to be objective. Don't imagine where you are or make yourselves any nicer than reality is."

🛠️ THE 15 TOOLS (4 Stages)

UNDERSTAND (6 tools):
• Circularity Ambition
• Circular Design Audit
• Stakeholder Map
• Value Chain Mapping
• Research Planning
• Interviews Tool

DEFINE (3 tools):
• Research Insights
• User & Partner Personas
• Circular Design Brief

IDEATE (3 tools):
• Ideation (using R Strategies)
• Solution Prioritization
• Circular Business Model Ideation

DEVELOP (3 tools):
• Future Value Chain Mapping
• Circular Business Model Canvas
• 100-Day Implementation Plan

💰 THE REALITY CHECK
"If it adds up, it all makes sense. If it doesn't, then it's a charity project. We are talking about actual working business models."

The Circular Business Model Canvas validates financial viability — costs, revenue, profit timeline.

💡 R STRATEGIES FOR BRAINSTORMING
• REFUSE: Eliminate harmful materials or activities
• REDUCE: Minimize what you can't refuse
• REPLACE: Substitute with better alternatives
• EXTEND LIFECYCLE: Repair, remanufacture, new services
• REGENERATE: Give back more than you take

⏱️ HOW LONG DOES IT TAKE?
"A good efficient transition process usually takes 5-7 tools over several months." Not all 15 — depends on how deep you want to go.

🌐 FREE AND OPEN SOURCE
• Available on Enterprise Estonia website
• Miro-based or printable worksheets
• Inspiration cards with real business cases
• Developed by HI Advisory + Estonian Business and Innovation Agency
• Funded by European Union
